column4: Hello, Font smoothing is under System > Preferences > Appearance. Sorry if someone beat me to it, I could see a reply.
alrighty.  Now if I just figure out my externals
External hard drives automount by default. Have you plug it in and nothing has happened?
they are plugged in.  I go to /media/ and only see Cdrom0
Are your externals formatted with an NTFS file system, by any chance?
yes, I am running Ubuntu atop of Windows.
Amazingly it still runs better than XP.
Atop as in a virtual system?
I mean I clicked the Install With Windows, not a virtual machine.
I tried Ubuntu over VMware, and it ran like crap
Ah, yeah, go figure. What I was going to say is that if an NTFS filesystem has been unplugged without being unmounted, Ubuntu will not mount it. It's a data protection thing, and a right nuisance.
I have thought about going full linux.. I don't know yet.  But I can't lose data on the drives, so I figure I will wait for that jump.
Solutions are; plug it into a windows machine, and ensure you use the "Safely remove hardware" function. Or there is a command line switch that can force it to mount.
116MB sounds about right. That number won't include anything it already has.
